verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
verses.ct: During the reign of Ahaz son of Jotham, son of Uzziah, as king of Judah, King Rezin of Syria and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel marched against Jerusalem to attack it, but they were unable to conquer it.

verses.kjv: And it was told the house of David, saying, Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.
verses.ct: When the royal house of David received the report that Syria had formed an alliance with Ephraim, Ahaz and his people trembled with fear, shaking like trees in a forest blown by the wind.

verses.kjv: Then said the LORD unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field;
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Isaiah, "Go out to meet Ahaz, and take your son Shearjashub with you. Meet him at the end of the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the road to the launderer's field."

verses.kjv: And say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.
verses.ct: "Tell him, 'Stay calm and keep your composure. Don't be afraid or lose heart over these 2 smoldering stubs of firewood — over the burning anger of Rezin and Syria and the son of Remaliah.

verses.kjv: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken evil counsel against thee, saying,
verses.ct: Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have plotted against you, saying,

verses.kjv: Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeal:
verses.ct: "Let's invade Judah, terrorize it, break through its defenses, and install the son of Tabeal as its king."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.
verses.ct: But this is what the Lord GOD says: It will not succeed. It will never happen.

verses.kjv: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people.
verses.ct: The capital of Syria is Damascus, and the ruler of Damascus is merely Rezin. Within 65 years, Ephraim will be shattered and will no longer exist as a people.

verses.kjv: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be established.
verses.ct: The capital of Ephraim is Samaria, and the ruler of Samaria is merely Remaliah's son. If you do not stand firm in your faith, you will not stand at all.'"

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD spake again unto Ahaz, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke again to Ahaz, saying,

verses.kjv: Ask thee a sign of the LORD thy God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.
verses.ct: "Ask for a sign from the LORD your God — ask for something from the deepest depths or from the highest heights."

verses.kjv: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the LORD.
verses.ct: But Ahaz replied, "I won't ask. I refuse to put the LORD to the test."

verses.kjv: And he said, Hear ye now, O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?
verses.ct: Then Isaiah said, "Listen carefully, house of David! Isn't it enough that you exhaust the patience of people? Must you exhaust the patience of my God as well?"

verses.kjv: Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
verses.ct: "So the Lord himself will give you a sign: Look — a virgin will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and she will name him Immanuel."

verses.kjv: Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil, and choose the good.
verses.ct: He will eat curds and honey until he is old enough to tell the difference between wrong and right.

verses.kjv: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her kings.
verses.ct: Because before that child is old enough to distinguish wrong from right, the land of the 2 kings you dread will be abandoned.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father’s house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: The LORD will bring on you, on your people, and on your father's house a time of trouble unlike anything since the day Ephraim split away from Judah — he will bring the king of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD will whistle for the flies from the distant streams of Egypt and for the bees from the land of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.
verses.ct: They will all come and settle in the steep ravines, in the crevices of the rocks, on every thornbush, and on every watering hole.

verses.kjv: In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, namely, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet: and it shall also consume the beard.
verses.ct: On that day, the Lord will use a razor hired from beyond the Euphrates River — the king of Assyria — to shave the hair from your head, your legs, and your beard as well.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall nourish a young cow, and two sheep;
verses.ct: On that day, a person will keep alive just one young cow and 2 sheep.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.
verses.ct: Yet because of the abundance of milk they produce, he will eat curds. Everyone left in the land will survive on curds and honey.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, it shall even be for briers and thorns.
verses.ct: On that day, every place where there once were 1,000 grapevines worth 1,000 pieces of silver will be overtaken by thorns and weeds.

verses.kjv: With arrows and with bows shall men come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.
verses.ct: People will go there only with bows and arrows, because the entire land will be covered with thorns and weeds.

verses.kjv: And on all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns: but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and for the treading of lesser cattle.
verses.ct: As for all the hillsides that were once cultivated with hoes, you won't go there anymore for fear of the thorns and weeds. They will become open pasture where cattle roam and sheep trample the ground.
